Description: Rim and wall fragment of East Greek pottery plate or standed bowl. On the slipped inside of the rim, a stopt maeander frieze, then a band; set of bars flanked by perhaps lotus flowers to the centre. On the clay ground of the exterior, narrow bands. The paint fired to red (2.5 YR 5/6).
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by the Greco-Roman Museum, Alexandria. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.
Bibliographic references: Venit 1988 / Greek Painted Pottery from Naukratis in Egyptian Museums (p. 31, no. 113 pl. 29)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GG.157)
